Napoli captain Marek Hamsik confirms “maybe now is the time when our paths will diverge”, amid rumours of a move to China.

The Slovakian midfielder’s father revealed today that his son is considering offers from the Far East, and is likely to move on.

Any deal may have to wait until the winter, but now the player himself has confirmed that he’s thinking of leaving.


“We believed we could finally get the Scudetto this year,” Hamsik told Pravda.

“I’m disappointed that we missed out on the title again. I’m sorry, because our great fans deserve this triumph, and I thank them for their great support.

“I’ve spent all this time here, giving all my strength. Maybe now is the time when our paths will diverge, I’d like to try something new.”

Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis has warned Marek Hamsik that he will not let him move to China cheaply. ‘I don’t do discounts for anyone’

“Balotelli? We haven’t taken him into consideration,” he said in an address at the University of Naples Federico II.

“He’s extraordinary, but first of all we have to understand the possibilities of players currently here with Ancelotti during preseason.


“We have so many players in attack, we can’t hurt those who are here and have never played for Napoli.

“To think that our attack is a priority is a mistake. Our priorities are different. Hamsik? I told him, ‘where are you going? This is your home.’

“After that, it’s up to him if he wants to leave, but I don’t do discounts for anyone. Insigne? He’s a Neapolitan symbol and sometimes he forgets how difficult it is for the Neapolitans to play for Napoli.

“Has there been any contact with Sarri? No, no-ones called me, but his clause was put in for protection. It was a bilateral decision.”
會長

Achraf Hakimi’s agent has confessed that the Real Madrid right-back would be ‘privileged’ to join Napoli.

Achraf has emerged as a potential target for Napoli, given their recent appointment of former Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti, and Alejandro Camano admits it would be ‘wonderful’ if the Italian asked for the teenager.

“The truth is that the Napoli sporting director is a man who follows all the best European players, but I’ve never talked to him about Achraf,” he told Radio Kiss Kiss.


“Real Madrid don’t have a Coach right now, and everything depends on who their next Coach will be.

“I have to talk to the club as Zidane’s departure took everyone aback somewhat. Achraf joined Real at a very young age and has a long contract with them.

“However, we think the lad has to leave Real so he can play regularly and grow, but I don’t know if Real agree.

“Playing for Napoli would be a privilege for him because they have an incredible fan base. I haven’t heard from them, but it would be wonderful if Ancelotti asked for him.

“All Real Madrid’s players speak very highly about the new Napoli Coach.”

The Roma youth product spent the second half of last season on loan at Parma, helping the Gialloblu return to Serie A after three years away.


However, Tuttomercato claims Getafe, who tried to sign the 24-year-old midway through the previous campaign, remain interested.

The site explains the Spanish side are negotiating another loan for Ciciretti with an option to buy next summer.

The Austrian turns 26 next month and last season provided two goals with 11 assists in 55 competitive games.

Carlo Ancelotti claims Marek Hamsik could replace Jorginho in Napoli’s midfield after being officially unveiled as the club’s new Coach.

“What convinced me to accept Napoli’s offer? So many reasons,” he began.

“Napoli believe in me and my abilities. I also had the desire to find an interesting project, one that had the scope to grow.


“The objective is to compete on all fronts. Ronaldo? Italian football greatly benefits from his arrival. For us, it’s a great source of motivation.

"I admired Sarri’s style of play. The team have important qualities. The top players are the ones we think are best, not the ones who get paid the most.

“The team are strong. It’s not easy to improve this squad. Hamsik? We could play him in Jorginho’s position.

“We also have Diawara, who is young and will do well. Mertens can also play between the lines.

“Juventus? They’ll be a difficult team to face, but they will be along with Inter, Roma and the others.

“I’m here to win. We have big ambitions and motivations. Living in this city is stimulating. I chose to live in the city because Naples is a beautiful city for me.

“There’s a magnificent landscape [in Naples], and I’m living there willingly. The squad? I’d already received information on them.

“The players here are young and receptive, while the others are experts such as Callejon, Hamsik and Albiol.

“Mertens? He can play as a No 9, behind the striker and between the lines. It amazed me that he scored so many goals as a striker.

“The new arrivals? Meret’s a young talent, who is good technically. Karnezis has experience, Inglese did very well at Chievo and Fabian Ruiz is young and complete, although he doesn’t have the characteristics to play in front of the defence.

“Verdi? Like Mertens, he’s very good between the lines in the final third. Formation? We can play in different ways. Our first objective? To progress from our Champions League group.

“Growth of the team? It’s not a question of growth, the lads here have shown that they are ready. They’ve been at the top for several years. Our collective knowledge can only help.

“The 91 points of last season? Leagues can also be won with 85 points…

“Transfers? It was said that I’d talked to many players: Ronaldo, Benzema, Cavani, David Luiz... I didn’t talk to them.

“We’re looking for a right-back and we still have to assess Ghoulam, but I’m not worried about his condition. VAR? It’s a positive innovation.”

Napoli owner Aurelio De Laurentiis has confirmed Marko Rog could join Sevilla but suggested that he will only let the midfielder leave permanently.

Sevilla emerged as Rog’s favoured destination over Schalke on Thursday, and De Laurentiis claimed the Croatian would be allowed to join the Spanish high-fliers, providing Napoli Coach Carlo Ancelotti gave the green light.

“I’m not used to buying players and then loaning them out,” he told ABC de Sevilla.


“It’s not in my philosophy and we don’t want to do that. Rog to Sevilla? It’s possible, but they’re not the only club who want the Croatian.

“There are many teams interested in him. I have to go back to Italy and talk to Ancelotti. Once I do that, we’ll make a decision and know what to do.”

Carlo Ancelotti has confirmed that Allan will not face Milan on Saturday but insisted the Napoli midfielder will not join Paris Saint-Germain this month.

“He didn’t train much and had a tough week,” he said at a Press conference.

“We’ll keep him here to train and prepare for Tuesday. The only thing I know is that Allan will stay.

“He’s an important player for us and he’ll be even more so in this second part of the season.

“It wasn’t difficult to manage Allan because everything was very clear. On our part there was no need to sell him.        

“There was the prospect of PSG buying him, but then there are conditions and requests. If the offers don’t satisfy the club, nothing changes.

“The club accepted the needs of the player to move if there the conditions for him to do so, but the player is aware [that isn’t the case] and we won’t have problems with him. De Laurentiis doesn’t want to sell his players.”

Carlo Ancelotti confirmed Marek Hamsik “is in negotiations and wants to have another experience” in China, so Napoli are “inclined to give him” that option.

The 31-year-old midfielder and captain had already been close to a transfer over the summer, but remained at the Stadio San Paolo.

According to reports, he could sign a contract over the next 48 hours with Dalian Yifang and not original targets Guangzhou Evergrande.


Sportitalia claim they are offering €25m to buy the Slovakia international.

“There are negotiations on-going, we have to evaluate along with the player,” confirmed Ancelotti on Sky Sport Italia after the 3-0 win over Sampdoria.

“The club has huge respect for this player, as he wrote history with Napoli, but if he wants to have another experience, we tend to want to make him happy.

“There are talks. We are not hiding anything. As far as I and the club are concerned, if the player wants to try this new experience, we are inclined to give him what he wants.”

Hamsik has been at Napoli since July 2007 and holds the all-time club record of appearances for the Partenopei, as tonight was his 520th and presumably final game with 121 goals.

咸錫（Marek Hamsik）將在職業生涯末段，轉到中國球壇掘金，以下為深情的告別信，短短數小時已得到近18萬個like：「我永遠熱愛拿玻里，首先要向球迷道歉，即將我要離開這兒。我夢想在球場中央被你們的掌聲包圍，無論人生的高潮抑或低谷，你們都是無條件支持我，我真心感激你們。我將拿玻里紋在身上，紀念我們相隔25年後再奪意大盃，那一刻終身難忘。」 咸錫強調全家人都流拿玻里的藍血：「當我改寫隊史上陣和入球紀錄，那一刻也令我感到驕傲，而且家中3名小孩也在這兒誕生，體內留著那不勒斯人的血液。感謝所有人，會長讓我效力12年，也接受我的轉會要求。我會想念你們，希望將來有緣再聚，祝福球隊取得今季歐霸盃錦標！」
